snippet: The new rules will prohibit federal agents from considering religion, national origin, gender and sexual orientation in their investigations, a government official said.
abstract: Justice Department is set to significantly expand its definition of racial profiling to prohibit federal agents from considering religion, national origin, gender and sexual orientation in their investigations; move addresses decade of criticism from civil rights groups that say federal authorities have in particular singled out Muslims and Latinos.
lead_paragraph: The new rules will prohibit federal agents from considering religion, national origin, gender and sexual orientation in their investigations, a government official said.

headline.main: U.S. to Expand Rules Limiting Use of Profiling by Federal Agents
headline.print_headline: U.S. Move Seen to Add Limits Over Profiling
